title: Which elements from the Periodic Table are chemical elements? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well there are 'molecular elements' such at the diatomic ones such as hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, chlorine, bromine, fluorine, and iodine.  What is your definition of chemical however? A compound by definition is two or more atoms bonded together in definite proportions.   An element could be considered a chemical.  Yet it is not a compound.  Chemicals comprise elements and compounds, so technically you could consider elements chemicals.

If by chemical you mean artificial, then Technetium and all the elements with atomic numbers greater than 92 ( Uranium ) are man made. Every tangible thing in this universe, apart from elementary particles, is made up of chemicals. To say that chemicals are not natural is therefore wrong.
